China is a vast country with plenty of things to do and visit. It is important that you should plan your first trip to China so that you can experience the essence of this vast country within few days of your traveling. Top Things To Do in China Hike Great Wall of China: It is one among the 7 wonders of the world which represents China on world map. The most integrated and best preserved sections are close to Beijing which most of the travelers usually hike. The Forbidden City in Beijing: The Forbidden City was the imperial palace of the Ming and Qing Dynasties for 560 years. One must visit this palace to see ancient Chinese architecture and heritage. Giant Pandas: Cuddly and lovable Giant Pandas are national treasure of China. The best place to see them are around Chengdu in Sichuan Province, “the giant pandas’ home town”. The Bund, Shanghai: The Bund is one of the most recognizable architectural symbols of Shanghai. The Terracota Army: Visit Xian to see museum of the Terracotta Army. The terracotta army, buried in 210 BC with the first emperor of the Qin dynasty, is a breathtaking site. Urban Hong Kong: It is among the top tourist cities of China. This urban and fast city is quiet famous for food, beaches, hills and island parks. 
Best Time to Travel China 
Avoid national and other major holidays during your trip. The reason being transport and hotels are packed and they charge double or more. Besides, above places are good to travel all year round except Hong Kong, which is quiet cold in the winter. 
How To Travel Within China 
Subway, Metro and Light Rails are fast, efficient and cheap mode of transport within the country. Taxis are also cheap and easy to find. Trains are best way to travel long distances, especially while traveling from one city to another. 
What To Get Ready For Travel 
Get you travel documents like Passport and VISA well in advance before booking flight tickets and hotel accommodation. Another important essential is to get an international China SIM card in India . It will save you from searching and buying local sim card in China. There are a couple of renowned telecom providers like Clay Telecom and OneSim Card which offers custom made plans designed exclusively for your traveling needs. Source:   ABOUT THE AUTHOR 
The author is a vivid traveler and loves to roam around the world. He is sharing his experience and what to keep in mind while travelling to China for first time.
